# VegVault is published!

There are seversal parts of the VegVault project that are now available for you to explore:

- [VegVault website](https://bit.ly/VegVault)
- [Pre-print publication](https://doi.org/10.1101/2025.01.31.635213) - "*VegVault database: linking global paleo-, and neo-vegetation data with functional traits and abiotic drivers*" [![static-badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/DOI-10.1101/2025.01.31.635213-blue)](https://doi.org/10.1101/2025.01.31.635213)
- [VegVault Database v1.0.0 ](https://doi.org/10.48700/datst.m7ky4-4de51) 
  - Please check [Guidelines for data reuse and update](https://ondrejmottl.github.io/VegVault/website/database_access.html#guidelines-for-data-reuse-and-update)
- [{vaultkeepr} R-package](https://bit.ly/vaultkeepr)
  - In order to make usage of the VegVault database as easy as possible, we have developed an R-package called {vaultkeepr}, providing a suite of functions to effectively interact with the database directly from the R programming language. Functions include opening the database, extracting datasets, filtering samples, and accessing specific taxa and traits. This package is a well-tested interface ([![Codecov-test-coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/OndrejMottl/vaultkeepr/branch/main/graph/badge.svg)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/OndrejMottl/vaultkeepr?branch=main)).
